input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Removes the specified access points from the discovery Step 2 and Step 3 list. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>delete</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <accesspoint> <accesspoint-ids>1001 1002</accesspoint-ids> </accesspoint> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. accesspoint[Required] Indicates that an entry of type accesspoint is being deleted here. accesspoint-ids[Required] space-separated list of ids of accesspoints to be deleted
2. Removes all access points from the discovery Step 2 and Step 3 list. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>delete</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <accesspoint> <all/> </accesspoint> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. accesspoint[Required] Indicates that an entry of type accesspoint is being deleted here. all[Required] Indicates that all accesspoints should be deleted.
3. Removes database information. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>delete</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <application> <databaseinfo> <port>1521</port> <type>oracle</type> <address>172.16.49.104</address> <server>172.16.49.104</server> </databaseinfo> </application> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. application[Required] Indicates that an entry of type application is being deleted here. databaseinfo[Required] Indicates that an entry of type databaseinfo is being deleted here. port[Required] Port to be deleted. type[Required] Database type.Valid values - Oracle/SYBASE/SQLServer/Cache address[Required] Host IP/DNS Name. server[Required] IP of Database Server.
4. Removes the specified domain controller from the list. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>delete</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <application> <domaincontrollerinfo-id>1234</domaincontrollerinfo-id> </application> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. application[Required] Indicates that an entry of type application is being deleted here. domaincontrollerinfo-id[Required] id of the domain controller to be deleted.
5. Removes the specified port number from the TNS Listener Port list. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>delete</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <application> <tnslistenerport>1234</tnslistenerport> </application> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. application[Required] Indicates that an entry of type application is being deleted here. tnslistenerport[Required] Port entry to be deleted.
6. Collects infrastructure and backup data during Discovery Data Collection. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <details> <backup/> <infrastructure/> </details> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. details[Required] Indicates an discovery details search request. backup[Required] Indicates that backup details are also discovered. infrastructure[Required] Indicates that infrastructure details are also discovered.
7. Collects only backup data during Discovery Data Collection. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <details> <backup/> </details> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. details[Required] Indicates an discovery details search request. backup[Required] Indicates that backup details are also discovered.
8. Collects element details for the specified discovery groups. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <details> <discoverygroup> <discoverygroup-ids>10001</discoverygroup-ids> <backup>true</backup> <sync>true</sync> <refresh>true</refresh> <infrastructure>true</infrastructure> </discoverygroup> </details> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. details[Required] Indicates an discovery details search request. discoverygroup[Required] Indicates that discoverygroups are being referred here. discoverygroup-ids[Required] space-separated list of ids of discoverygroups backup[Optional if infrastructure is provided] Indicates that backup details are also discovered. infrastructure[Optional if backup is provided] Indicates that infrastructure details are also discovered. refresh[Optional if infrastructure is provided] Forces the device manager to refresh. sync[Optional if backup is provided] The command will be in synchronous mode, meaning the management server will not accept new commands until it is done with discovery.
9. Stops the collection of infrastructure and backup data during Discovery Data Collection. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <details> <stop/> </details> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. details[Required] Indicates an discovery details request. stop[Required] Indicates that discoverygroups are being referred here.
10. Refreshes details of all the elements in a fabric. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <refresh> <fabric-id>1234</fabric-id> </refresh> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. refresh[Required] Indicates a refresh request. fabric-id[Required] id of the fabric whose details will be refreshed.
11. Collects infrastructure data during Discovery Data Collection for a specified storage system, but does not delete components that no longer exist Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <refresh> <storagesystem-id>1234</storagesystem-id> </refresh> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. refresh[Required] Indicates a refresh request. storagesystem-id[Required] id of the storagesystem whose details will be refreshed.
12. Collects infrastructure data during Discovery Data Collection for a specified switch, but does not delete components that no longer exist. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>discover</command> <category>domaindiscovery</category> <process-id>update-discovery-parameters</process-id> <command-arguments> <refresh> <switch-id>1234</switch-id> </refresh> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. refresh[Required] Indicates a refresh request. switch-id[Required] id of the switch whose details will be refreshed.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Removes the specified access points from the discovery Step 2 and Step 3 list. 2. Removes all access points from the discovery Step 2 and Step 3 list. 3. Removes database information. All of the parameters are mandatory. 4. Removes the specified domain controller from the list. 5. Removes the specified port number from from the TNS Listener Port list. 6. Collects infrastructure and backup data during Discovery Data Collection. 7. Collects only backup data during Discovery Data Collection. 8. Collects element details for the specified discovery groups. 9. Stops the collection of infrastructure and backup data during Discovery Data Collection. 10. Refreshes details of all the elements in a fabric. 11. Collects infrastructure data during Discovery Data Collection for a specified storage system, but does not delete components that no longer exist. 12. Collects infrastructure data during Discovery Data Collection for a specified switch, but does not delete components that no longer exist.
